post_text:
Hi everybody,
I am about to study in New Zealand without knowing which service to transfer money from Vietnam with the fastest and most convenient service. How do people use it, give me some experience.
Thank you very much!
comments: Huỳnh Võ Quỳnh Phương	Need Swap directly text me. I need to send
Đoàn Thị Thanh Maii	My friend, you need a few thousand living expenses, then exchange for the Exim exchange rate.

Phong Nguyen	With large amounts of money, it should be transferred to the bank for safety. In Vietnam, almost every bank has a foreign transfer service for the study abroad. 20 years ago, Eximbank had the best fee and now the mayor has changed - I'm hard to take a walk for a few banks to see who offer offer good exchange rate + low fee, go with that bank
Minh An	After exchanging USDT, I will withdraw back to NZ's account

Hồng Ngọc	Hello,
First, when studying abroad, there will be money to pay such as tuition fees, living expenses, rent/ dormitory.
- Tuition fee: You can transfer to the school's account in New Zealand according to the school's notice.
- When you have passed New Zealand, you go to the bank account to open a bank account, family members can transfer the living/ tuition fee via your account.
However, each case will have a slightly different profile.
If you need detailed advice, you can contact me via 0336018116 (Zalo/Messenger/Viber/Phone)
I am Ngoc- Director of International Payment Service Development Bank MSB. My side specializes in transferring money to foreign countries, free transfer of money, competitive exchange rates, simple records.

New Zealand Today	https: //www.nzviet.com /.../ gioi-thieu-ezyremit-giai-phap ...
